docs.snippet: Hezbollah vowed to continue its fight against "terrorists" after Thursday's double attack in an area in its Beirut southern suburb which killed at least 37 people....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hezbollah vowed to continue its fight against "terrorists" after Thursday's double attack in an area in its Beirut southern suburb which killed at least 37 people.

headline.main: Hezbollah Vows to Continue Fight Against 'Terrorists' After Beirut Attacks
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Vows to Continue Fight Against 'Terrorists' After Beirut Attacks

docs.snippet: An Ohio man accused of using social media to promote violence against U.S. service members opened at least eight anonymous online accounts in quick succession to make threats, even as Twitter kept suspending them and federal agents raced to find h...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Ohio man accused of using social media to promote violence against U.S. service members opened at least eight anonymous online accounts in quick succession to make threats, even as Twitter kept suspending them and federal agents raced to find him, court documents say.

headline.main: Ohio Man Allegedly Urged Service Members' Killings Online
headline.print_headline: Ohio Man Allegedly Urged Service Members' Killings Online

docs.snippet: What happened to progressive national politicians in their 40s and 50s? Triangulation....
docs.lead_paragraph: What happened to progressive national politicians in their 40s and 50s? Triangulation.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Mark Schmitt questions why there are so few Democratic politicians of national prominence in their 40s and 50s; posits middle-age Democrats were raised in era lacking fierce ideology needed to succeed in modern politics; holds middle-age Republicans, by contrast, were influenced by Reagan 1980s and backlash politics of Newt Gingrich; says future generations will alter political landscape, but current situation demonstrates long shadow cast by each generation.

docs.snippet: A proposed federal rule, announced on Thursday, opens the latest front in the long-running campaign to curb unwanted exposure to secondhand tobacco smoke....
docs.lead_paragraph: A proposed federal rule, announced on Thursday, opens the latest front in the long-running campaign to curb unwanted exposure to secondhand tobacco smoke.
docs.abstract: Housing and Urban Development Dept rule currently being considered would ban smoking in all public housing, as part of effort to reduce harmful secondhand smoke; critics say ban infringes on personal rights and would be impossible to enforce.

headline.main: Public Housing Nationwide May Be Subject to Smoking Ban
headline.print_headline: Public Housing May Be Subject to Smoking Ban

byline.contributor: Emily Palmer and Eli Rosenberg contributed reporting.
